```{r setup, include=FALSE}
# setup chunk options
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  echo = FALSE,
  collapse = TRUE,
  comment = "#>", 
  tidy = TRUE
)

# load packages
# packages for data import
library(REDCapR)
library(ncdfFlow)

# packages for data manipulation
library(tidyverse)
library(dplyr)
library(purrr)
library(lubridate)
library(janitor)
library(skimr)
library(data.table)

# packages for data export
library(writexl)
```

## Import data
### - csv or excel data
<font color="grey"><i> 
read.csv("yourcsvfile.csv") 
</i></font>

### - RDS
<font color="grey"><i>
read_rds("yourrdsfile.rds")
</i></font>

### - REDcap data
<font color="grey"><i>
redcap_read(redcap_uri = api.uri, token = api.token, raw_or_label = 'label',verbose = FALSE) 
</i></font>

### - flow cytometry data
<font color="grey"><i>
read.ncdfFlowSet(yourfcsfiles) 
</i></font>

### - other types of data

## Check the raw data
<font color="grey"><i>
dplyr::glimpse(raw_data)  
ggplot(data = raw_data, aes(x = x_var, y = y_var , color = col_var)) + geom_boxplot()  
</i></font>

```{r}
dplyr::glimpse(iris)  
ggplot(data = iris, aes(x = Sepal.Length, y = Sepal.Width , color = Species)) + geom_boxplot() 
```

## Export data
### - export to csv/excel/RDS 
<font color="grey"><i> 
write.csv(iris, "iris.csv")  
write_xlsx(list(worksheet_name = iris), "iris.xlsx")   
write_rds(iris, "iris.rds")
</i></font>
